title: Suffering for Christ
summary: Rev. Ray Choi emphasizes the call for Christians to embrace suffering as a sign of true discipleship, reflecting on Christ's own suffering during Passion Week. He warns against returning to sinful patterns and urges believers to arm themselves with a mindset that endures trials for the sake of Christ, thereby growing in holiness and ceasing from sin.

title: Are You Stressed?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi explores how to overcome stress and anxiety through prayer, thanksgiving, and trust in Jesus. By shifting focus from personal burdens to gratitude and dependence on Christ’s strength, believers can experience abiding peace that transcends circumstances.

title: No Longer Living Out of a Spirit of Fear
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches on the difference between negative fear and the fear of the Lord, urging believers to cast out the spirit of fear and embrace a reverent fear of God that leads to wisdom, integrity, and perseverance. He challenges listeners to hold fast to Jesus, live without compromise, and endure faithfully to the end.

title: Worldly Christian
summary: Rev. Ray Choi warns against the dangers of worldliness, which leads to insincerity and spiritual instability in the Christian walk. He urges believers to close their hearts to the world, open their hearts fully to Jesus, and live solely for the glory of God, emphasizing a life of humility, sanctification, and eternal perspective over worldly praise and possessions.

title: Sincere Followers
summary: Rev. Ray Choi emphasizes the need for sincerity in following Jesus, distinguishing between those who genuinely seek Christ and those who pursue him for personal gain. True discipleship involves full surrender, deep relational prayer, and a desire to be with Jesus above all else.

title: Faith Leads to Freedom
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that only Jesus can set us free from sin and condemnation. Through the story of the woman caught in adultery, he illustrates how faith in Christ—not religion or rule-keeping—leads to forgiveness, freedom, and transformation, culminating in a life no longer enslaved to sin but empowered to live victoriously in Christ.

title: Learning How to Remain with Jesus
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that the key to fruitful discipleship is abiding in Jesus, the true vine. He emphasizes the importance of cultivating internal spiritual fruit—like humility, gentleness, and love—through a daily, intimate relationship with Christ, especially in times of crisis and hardship.

title: 3 Voices
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches on discerning the three voices we often hear: God's voice, the voice of the stranger (Satan), and our own. He explains how only the Good Shepherd leads to abundant life, while other voices bring confusion, deception, and destruction. Disciples must learn to recognize Jesus' voice through Scripture and surrender, resisting worldly and demonic influence.

title: 7 Signs of Jesus in John
summary: Rev. Ray Choi explores the seven signs in the Gospel of John as a roadmap of discipleship. He highlights two promises—transformation and eternal life—and five spiritual warnings that can derail believers: unhealthy attachment to loved ones, unrepentant sin, worldly desires, overwhelming circumstances, and fear of man. True discipleship requires daily surrender, repentance, and wholehearted devotion to Jesus.

title: Discipleship: Burning and Shining Lamps
summary: Rev. Ray Choi contrasts believers and disciples, urging Christians to become burning and shining lamps like John the Baptist. True discipleship involves daily encounters with Jesus, heartfelt repentance, humility, and shining His light to others. A disciple's passion and obedience inspire others to believe as they point consistently to Christ, not self.

title: Seek Jesus
summary: Rev. Ray Choi encourages listeners to seek Jesus continually, not merely through intellectual knowledge but through heartfelt encounters. Through John the Baptist’s humility and witness, and the calling of the first disciples, we see that true preparation to meet Christ comes through repentance, openness, and a life that points others to Him.

title: How to Have Confidence Before God
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that true confidence before God comes from walking both in love and in the light. Drawing from 1 John and the teachings of Jesus, he emphasizes the importance of abiding in Christ, practicing righteousness, and being free from habitual sin. This balanced walk leads to assurance on the day of judgment and a life of authentic fellowship with God.

title: Ask the Lord About the Soldier, Athlete, and Farmer
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on Paul's metaphors of the soldier, athlete, and farmer to illustrate the Christian journey of obedience, faith, and endurance. Believers are urged to live with disciplined focus, strive lawfully in faith through Christ’s righteousness, and patiently endure life’s toil for the reward of eternal glory and usefulness to God.

title: Training in Righteousness
summary: Rev. Ray Choi urges believers to train themselves in righteousness by growing in eight foundational virtues and equipping themselves with Scripture and the Holy Spirit. As deception and apostasy increase in the last days, Christians must be grounded in truth, reject false teaching, and be prepared for every good work, living fully surrendered lives with eternal focus.

title: Train Yourself for Godliness
summary: Rev. Ray Choi exhorts believers to actively train themselves in godliness by supplementing their faith with eight spiritual qualities outlined in 2 Peter 1. Emphasizing the critical role of self-control, he teaches that true spiritual maturity involves both God's divine power and our daily effort to grow in holiness, discernment, and love for others.

title: The Sacrifices We Give to God
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that the church is meant to be a house of prayer where believers offer spiritual sacrifices to God—not just in form or tradition, but in heartfelt surrender, praise, repentance, and intercession. He challenges listeners to reflect on their spiritual disciplines and interactions with others, emphasizing that true worship involves confession, blessing those who wrong us, and living lives centered on God's presence.

title: Home Is Where the Heart Is
summary: This Christmas sermon reflects on deep human longings—loneliness, the idol of romance, and the search for a perfect home—urging believers to seek intimacy with Jesus, who is Emmanuel, God with us. Rev. Ray Choi challenges listeners to place their heart in heaven with Christ, recognizing this world is not their home.

title: Deep Satisfaction, Fruitful Labor, Daily Contentment
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on Apostle Paul’s confession that to live is Christ and to die is gain, urging believers to pursue deep satisfaction in Jesus. From this wellspring flows fruitful labor and daily contentment, grounded in Christ’s strength and the assurance that God supplies all our needs.

title: Christian Character and Motivation
summary: This sermon explores the transformation expected of believers who are raised with Christ—putting off the old self and putting on virtues like compassion, humility, and love. Rev. Ray Choi challenges listeners to examine their hearts in relationships and motivations, emphasizing that all actions should be done for Jesus, not for people.

title: The One True Jesus
summary: Rev. Ray Choi urges believers to know and hold onto the one true Jesus, warning against many counterfeit versions taught in churches today. He emphasizes the importance of discerning truth through Scripture and the Holy Spirit, rejecting idolatry and worldliness, and maintaining a proper heart posture to avoid falling away from the real Christ.

title: Overcoming Fears
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches how Christians can overcome fear through God's love, prayer, and the full armor of God. Emphasizing that Jesus fights for us, the sermon encourages believers to rely on His strength, pray aloud with authority, and reject fear by being rooted in Christ’s perfect love.

title: Love and Respect
summary: This sermon explores how the biblical model of marriage and family trains believers for godliness and leadership in the Church. Rev. Ray Choi teaches that love and respect within the home mirror the relationship between Christ and the Church, urging believers to love God by keeping His commandments and to respect Him by doing His specific will.

title: How Do We Walk in Love?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that to walk in love means to live as a fragrant offering to God, like Christ, marked by sincerity and surrender. Christians are to walk wisely, as children of light, purified by fire and carrying the aroma of Christ wherever they go—not as peddlers of God’s word, but as sincere disciples transformed for His glory.

title: Speak the Truth in Love
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that Christians must grow up into Christ by speaking the truth in love. While many fall into error through philosophy, tradition, and legalism, true spiritual maturity comes by holding fast to Jesus, the Head. We must speak truth not from judgment or pride, but with humility, patience, and genuine love that wins others over to Christ.

title: Awakening Dormant Spiritual Gifts
summary: Rev. Ray Choi calls the church to rediscover and activate spiritual gifts through the empowerment of the Holy Spirit. Drawing from Ephesians 4 and 1 Corinthians 12, he emphasizes the diversity of gifts within the Body of Christ and encourages believers to fan their gifts into flame, serve one another, and partner together for the salvation of the world.

title: Vertical Peace, Horizontal Peace
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that the blood of Jesus not only reconciles us vertically with God, but also breaks down all horizontal walls of hostility between people. Ethnic, theological, cultural, and personal divisions must all fall in Christ, who is our peace and the cornerstone of one united church body.

title: Marks of a Christian
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that a true Christian is marked by deep faith in Christ’s supremacy, genuine love for all the saints, and a life of continual repentance. Rooted in God's love and filled with His Spirit, believers are called to walk in humility, unity, and spiritual maturity as members of Christ’s body.

title: What Is a Christian?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi opens a new series by asking two foundational questions: What is a Christian? What is the Church? Focusing on Ephesians, he teaches that Christians are those who are in Christ—called, adopted, filled with the Spirit, and growing in maturity. The church is the body of Christ, called to unity, love, and spiritual fullness through every believer playing their part.

title: Am I Forsaken by God?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi explores the tension between feeling forsaken by God and the promise that He will never leave us. Drawing from Psalm 22, he teaches that faith means rejecting our perception and circumstances to instead declare, 'Yet you, O Lord.' Even in seasons of silence and suffering, we are invited to sing, pray, and trust that God has heard us and will act in His time.

title: Disappointment
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on Peter's deep disappointment with himself, his circumstances, and even God after denying Jesus. In John 21, Jesus meets Peter again—not with rebuke, but with a gentle invitation to breakfast. This sermon reminds us that when we feel hopeless, the solution is not trying harder but meeting Jesus afresh and letting Him restore our hope.

title: Living Forgiven, Free, and Fearlessly
summary: Rev. Ray Choi warns against the dangers of worldliness, both secular and religious, emphasizing that Jesus came to expose the evil of the world and set us free. Drawing from John 7–8, he encourages believers to live as forgiven children of God, walking in spiritual freedom and standing fearlessly for Christ, even in the face of rejection.

title: Reasons We Miss Jesus
summary: Rev. Ray Choi explores why many people miss having a meaningful encounter with Jesus. Drawing from John 6, he outlines five reasons: treating Jesus as a means to an end, focusing on external works, greed for signs or blessings, assuming we already know Jesus, and abandoning Him when life gets hard. True discipleship requires sincere desire for Christ above all else, especially when His ways are hard to understand.

title: New Creation
summary: This sermon explores what it truly means to be a 'new creation' in Christ, emphasizing the transformation of perspective, passions, and purpose. Rev. Ray Choi urges believers to evaluate fruit, discern spiritual truth, and live by faith with the aim of pleasing God.

title: Mexico Missions 2024: Consistency, Simplicity, and Radical Generosity
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on a life-changing mission trip to Mexico, emphasizing the spiritual lessons of consistency, simplicity, and radical generosity. Through stories of poverty, partnership, and worship, the sermon calls believers to embrace God’s heart for the poor and live out the gospel in tangible ways.

title: The Gift of Revelation and the Greatness of Salvation
summary: Rev. Ray Choi emphasizes that true gratitude for salvation stems from divine revelation, not intellectual skill or ministry success. He urges believers to adopt childlike humility to receive this revelation and treasure the privilege of calling God 'Father.'

title: The Great Commission
summary: Rev. Ray Choi unpacks the biblical foundation of the Great Commission, emphasizing that all believers are called to proclaim the kingdom, heal the sick, and cast out demons with Christ’s power and authority. He challenges the church to depend wholly on Jesus and seek persons of peace as they are sent out to prepare the way for the Lord.

title: Salt and Light
summary: Rev. Ray Choi challenges believers to live as salt and light by embodying purity, influence, and generosity—especially toward the poor. Drawing from Jesus’ teachings and the upcoming mission trip to Mexico, the sermon calls for a renewed identity rooted in dependence on God, not money.

title: Salted with Fire
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that being 'salted with fire' refers to enduring trials that purify and strengthen faith. Drawing from 1 Peter and other Scripture, he emphasizes the necessity of suffering for spiritual maturity and calls believers to respond with worship, surrender, and dependence on Christ.

title: Seek First King Jesus
summary: Rev. Ray Choi calls believers to seek first the kingdom of God by surrendering personal desires, rejecting worldly influences, and aligning fully with the will and desires of King Jesus. True discipleship means pursuing Jesus above all else, not merely doing work for Him, and being trained to become trustworthy workers for His harvest.

title: Father's Day 2024
summary: Rev. Ray Choi emphasizes the importance of listening to and obeying both earthly parents and the heavenly Father. On Father's Day, he points to Jesus as the perfect Son who delighted the Father through complete obedience. We are called to listen closely to Jesus, drawing near enough to hear His quiet whispers and follow Him in humble submission.

title: How to Converse with God
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that reading the Bible should be a personal conversation with Jesus, not just study. By asking questions in response to stirred hearts and waiting for answers from Jesus, believers receive revelation, grow in fruitfulness, and mature in faith as citizens of God's kingdom.

title: Are You Stressed?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi encourages believers to live free of stress by trusting fully in their Heavenly Father’s care and provision. Drawing from Jesus' teaching in Matthew 6, he explains how faith, simplicity, and focusing on today's needs—not tomorrow’s—are keys to experiencing God’s peace and freedom from anxiety.

title: Pentecost 2024: Thirsting for More of the Holy Spirit
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that while all believers receive the Holy Spirit at salvation, we must continually ask for more of His presence and power. True spiritual maturity is marked not only by gifts but by growing fruit—especially love—and a deeper thirst for the Spirit who transforms us into Christ's likeness.

title: Imitating Christ's Humility
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on the Christlike humility experienced during a wedding weekend, teaching that true friendship and community are marked by meekness, servanthood, and love. He emphasizes that marriage is not only about companionship but a living picture of the deep, intimate friendship Jesus desires with His church.

title: Test the Spirits
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that believers must be vigilant in testing the spirits behind teachings and leaders in the church. Drawing from Scripture and modern examples, he exposes the dangers of the shepherding movement and warns against leaders who replace Christ's authority with their own. True discernment, he emphasizes, comes from the Holy Spirit and leads us to abide in Christ alone.

title: It's Time to Get in Shape
summary: Rev. Ray Choi exhorts believers to become malleable clay in the hands of the Divine Potter, shaped into the image of Christ through submission and humility. Addressing both personal growth and the failure of leadership, he calls the church to center itself on Jesus—the true Shepherd—and reject self-serving models of ministry.

title: A Life of No Regrets and No Boasting
summary: This sermon teaches that true wisdom comes not from human effort or intellect, but from revelation and encounter with Jesus Christ, who embodies God's wisdom. A life of no regrets and no boasting is possible when we trust in God's discipline, surrender our pride, and rest in Christ’s redemptive work.

title: Body Builders
summary: This sermon emphasizes that the church is not merely a building or a hub of ministry activity, but a spiritual body meant to grow into the fullness of Christ. Each member must build up others in love, speak the truth in Jesus, and reflect His character—putting off the old self and putting on Christ—to become a healthy, unified body.

title: Death to Life
summary: This sermon teaches that the Christian life follows a continual pattern of dying to the old self and being raised into new life with Christ. True transformation happens through daily encounters with Jesus, where we put off our fallen nature and put on His character, becoming more like Him over time.

title: Resurrection Day
summary: This Resurrection Day sermon emphasizes that Jesus is not just our Savior who secures heaven, but the living Christ who dwells in us and transforms every aspect of our lives. The full gospel is Christ in us—the hope of glory—leading to daily transformation, holiness, and maturity in every relationship, work, and interaction.

title: Ask, Seek, and Knock
summary: This sermon encourages believers to ask God for all things, seek Jesus with their whole heart, and knock continually on heaven’s door. Rev. Choi emphasizes the importance of abiding in Christ, examining our motives in prayer, and cultivating a deep relationship with Jesus, who is knocking on the door of our hearts.

title: Mountain-Moving Faith
summary: This sermon teaches that mountains will move in our lives when we combine absolute faith in Jesus, focused prayer, and righteous living. Rev. Choi outlines four types of faith—no faith, counterfeit faith, little faith, and absolute faith—and encourages believers to pursue a deeper walk with Christ that results in powerful, mountain-moving prayer.

title: Taking Our Thoughts Captive
summary: This sermon calls believers to take control of their thoughts and reject lies from the enemy that lead to bondage. Rev. Choi emphasizes that God’s truth—when believed and acted upon—sets us free from past trauma, present burdens, and future anxieties. By taking every thought captive to Christ, walking in faith, and resisting demonic deception, Christians can live in true spiritual freedom.

title: The Ruler of This World
summary: This sermon reveals the reality of spiritual warfare, emphasizing that Satan is the ruler of this world and works to blind, bind, and deceive. Rev. Choi urges believers to take Jesus at His word, stay close to Him, and engage in spiritual battle by recognizing demonic strongholds and casting out lies with truth. Victory and true freedom come only through Jesus, who is Jehovah Sabaoth—the Lord of Heaven’s Armies—fighting on our behalf.

title: Identifying Spiritual Blockages
summary: This sermon explores the causes of spiritual blockages that hinder our relationship with God. Rev. Choi explains that unrepented sin, hidden idolatry, and even God’s judgment can result in spiritual blindness or deafness. He emphasizes that Satan actively works to blind and deceive both believers and unbelievers. Deliverance, clarity, and freedom come through genuine repentance, thanksgiving, and calling upon Jesus—Jehovah Sabaoth, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies—to fight for us and remove every blockage.

title: The Anatomy of a Spiritual Fall
summary: This sermon explores how believers and churches can fall spiritually due to Satan’s tactics of division and deception. Rev. Choi uses the example of the Corinthian church to illustrate how internal division, false teachers, and worldliness can erode faith. He emphasizes the importance of holding on to Jesus daily as the only way to remain in the faith, resist lies, and reach final salvation.

title: Heart Exam
summary: This sermon challenges believers to bring their hearts before Jesus for a deep examination, allowing Him to expose hidden motivations, wounds, and spiritual blockages. Rev. Choi teaches that healing, repentance, and casting down strongholds lead to a heart free from anxiety, agitation, and fear. Only by letting Jesus address these core issues can we receive His lasting peace and protection.

title: The Affection and Compassion of Christ
summary: This sermon calls believers to open their hearts wide to receive the deep affection and compassion of Christ. Rev. Choi explains how bitterness, unforgiveness, and a closed heart hinder both receiving God's love and extending it to others. He contrasts the intense, gut-level compassion of Jesus with our often restricted affection, and invites the church to be transformed through prayer and repentance into people who love like Christ.

title: God Gives Grace to the Humble
summary: This sermon emphasizes that grace is available in unlimited measure, but only to those who humble themselves before the Lord. Rev. Choi contrasts the proud—who act independently of God and are opposed by Him—with the humble, who surrender daily and seek God’s specific will. He explains that grace is hand-delivered by Jesus to the lowly, and true humility is marked by a mindset of surrender and a life of obedience modeled after Christ.

title: Love Jesus More in 2024
summary: This sermon urges believers to make 2024 the year they love Jesus with all their heart, soul, mind, and strength—the greatest commandment. Rev. Choi emphasizes the relational nature of faith, where true love for Jesus must overflow into mercy for others. Only by being filled with Christ’s love can we consistently love our neighbors. He warns against religious autopilot and challenges the church to recover a deep, personal, and affectionate relationship with Jesus.

title: New Year’s Eve 2023
summary: This sermon calls believers to reflect on the past year not by what they have gained, but by what they have given to Jesus. Rev. Choi teaches that true discipleship means hating one’s life in this world and surrendering fully to Christ, following His example of self-sacrifice. Only by letting go of worldly glory and living for eternal life can we truly see and serve Jesus with open eyes and hearts.

title: Christmas Eve 2023
summary: This Christmas message emphasizes the contrast between light and darkness, portraying Jesus as the true light who brings life and salvation. Rev. Ray Choi invites listeners to come out of darkness, receive Jesus, and believe in His name to become children of God.

title: How Can I Please God?
summary: This sermon explores how to live a life that pleases God by seeking His glory rather than human approval. Rev. Ray Choi emphasizes following Jesus closely, rejecting man-centered validation, and maintaining a heart that burns for Christ as the path to divine commendation.

title: Patient Endurance
summary: This sermon urges believers to develop patient endurance and spiritual strength in preparation for the trials of the end times. Rev. Ray Choi exhorts listeners to be shrewd relationally and financially, stay awake spiritually, strengthen their faith, and hold fast to Jesus no matter the cost.

title: Salt That Has Lost Its Taste
summary: This sermon explores Jesus' call to radical discipleship, emphasizing the need for total surrender, counting the cost, and loving Christ above all else. Rev. Ray Choi urges believers to become spiritually 'salty' again by humbling themselves, starting fresh, and pursuing a deep, transformative relationship with Jesus that results in genuine impact.

title: Rapture and the Return of Christ
summary: In this sermon, Rev. Ray Choi addresses the complexities surrounding the rapture and return of Christ, urging believers to hold theological positions loosely while holding tightly to Jesus. He emphasizes being homesick for heaven, hating this life, and staying faithful and wise as the key to being ready for the Lord's visible, loud, and sudden return.

title: A Meaningful Contact with Jesus
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on the story of the ten lepers to emphasize the importance of having meaningful, personal encounters with Jesus rather than just seeking His blessings. He encourages believers to view trials and frustrations as opportunities to draw closer to Christ and give heartfelt thanks.

title: Am I Growing Spiritually?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi challenges believers to evaluate whether they are truly growing in the grace and knowledge of Jesus Christ. Drawing from 2 Peter and James, he underscores that genuine faith is active, evidenced by works, and that spiritual maturity requires diligence, self-examination, and a daily walk with Jesus as our best friend.

title: Make Every Effort to Be Fruitful
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches from 2 Peter 1 on the importance of making every effort to grow in key spiritual qualities—virtue, knowledge, self-control, perseverance, godliness, brotherly affection, and love—in order to know Jesus more intimately and avoid spiritual regression. Fruitfulness in our knowledge of Christ is the true measure of maturity.

title: Where Can I Find True Wisdom?
summary: This sermon explores the biblical understanding of wisdom, distinguishing it from worldly knowledge and emphasizing that true wisdom comes from above. Rev. Ray Choi urges believers to seek wisdom from God with faith, avoid prideful knowledge, and hold tightly to Jesus, who is the embodiment of God’s wisdom. He calls for prayerful discernment amid global conflict and cautions against choosing sides in political strife.

title: A Prayer That Hits the Mark
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that true intercessory prayer reflects God’s heart and will, aiming for salvation and peace for all people. He encourages believers to move beyond self-centered prayers to those that seek the quiet and peaceable life Scripture commands—both personally and globally—and to reflect Christ’s humility and restraint in speech and action.

title: Stand Firm
summary: Rev. Ray Choi explains how Satan tempts believers through subtle thoughts, especially during wilderness seasons of testing. Drawing from Jesus' temptations in the desert, he teaches that victory comes through submission to God, standing firm in faith, resisting the devil, and relying on Jesus as our model and strength.

title: Does God Still Speak Today?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi answers the question of whether God still speaks today by showing how, throughout Scripture and today, God speaks in many biblical ways—through His Son, the Holy Spirit, the Bible, dreams, visions, others, and even circumstances. He warns against intellectual pride and spiritual dullness, urging believers to seek personal relationship and discernment rather than relying only on biblical principles without encountering the living Christ.

title: What Is in Your Heart?
summary: Rev. Ray Choi reflects on how different life seasons—whether wandering in the wilderness or entering the promised land—expose the true condition of our hearts. Using the examples of Korah’s rebellion and Israel's journey, he urges believers to deal with pride, complaining, and rebellion before God, emphasizing that heart transformation is more important than changing circumstances.

title: Submit Under God's Authority
summary: Rev. Ray Choi calls believers to submit under God's appointed authorities—whether in the government, church, workplace, or home—highlighting rebellion as a root sin that leads to pride, slander, and discontent. Drawing from Korah's rebellion and the structure of godly authority in Scripture, he exhorts Christians to reject grumbling, embrace their God-assigned lot, and cultivate a heart of gratitude and humility as evidence of true submission to God's sovereign rule.

title: From Faith to Faith, By Faith
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that the Christian life is meant to be lived by continually trusting in Jesus—from faith to faith. Drawing from Habakkuk and Romans, he emphasizes that righteousness is not only imputed to believers by faith, but also cultivated through daily surrender and relationship with Christ. As we turn to Jesus in every circumstance, we are transformed into His likeness, moving from doctrine to daily dependence, and growing into practical righteousness.

title: Jesus in Genesis 21
summary: This sermon explores the spiritual meaning of Genesis 21, where the birth of Isaac foreshadows the promised Son, Jesus Christ, and highlights the contrast between the flesh (Ishmael) and the Spirit (Isaac). It emphasizes the need to cast out the fleshly self to fully live in the joy and freedom of the spiritual new birth, forming a third nation united in Christ beyond Jew or Gentile.

title: Soul Health
summary: This sermon emphasizes the difference between momentary rest and lasting soul rest that Jesus offers. Rev. Choi urges believers to bring both external burdens and internal struggles—mental, emotional, and volitional—to Jesus, learning from Him to live by faith and experience continual peace and transformation.

title: Absolute Surrender, Absolute Faith, Absolutely Satisfied
summary: Rev. Ray Choi teaches that the Christian life begins with absolute surrender, leads to absolute faith in Jesus, and results in being absolutely satisfied in Him. Drawing from John 6, he emphasizes communion as an act of deep worship and abiding in Christ, urging believers to prioritize internal transformation and union with Christ over external ministry efforts.

title: Living in Communion as Worshipers
summary: This sermon teaches that worship is not confined to Sunday services, but is a continuous, 16-hour-a-day communion with God. Rev. Choi explains how believers are priests who minister before the Lord through prayer and praise, entering the holy presence of God through Jesus. Emphasizing spiritual identity and New Covenant access to the Father, he urges believers to live as true worshipers in spirit and truth.

title: We Are God's Church
summary: This sermon challenges believers to stop viewing church as a place or program and instead embrace their identity as the living church. Rev. Choi unpacks how the Old Testament tabernacle symbolizes the believer’s journey—from self-centeredness to self-denial, communion, and becoming love—emphasizing that real growth means becoming like Christ and shining His light daily.

title: Enjoying God
summary: This sermon emphasizes the joy of simply enjoying God for who He is, not for what He gives. Rev. Choi uses Luke 15 to highlight the tragedy of spiritual lostness among churchgoers who lose sight of their identity as beloved children of God. True worship flows from a good conscience and constant awareness of God's presence, resulting in transformed hearts that bless others.

title: Priests Called to Praise, Thank, and Bless
summary: This sermon teaches that all believers are priests who have direct access to God through Jesus Christ, our High Priest. Rev. Choi emphasizes that our priestly role is to offer spiritual sacrifices—chiefly praise, thanksgiving, and blessings—through our lips. A good conscience enables believers to remain aware of God's presence and bless others even in the face of hardship.

title: Worship in Spirit and Truth
summary: This sermon explores Jesus' call to worship the Father in spirit and in truth. Rev. Choi highlights the importance of reviving our spirits and reclaiming our identity as children of God, not religious performers. True worship is personal, spiritual, and transformative—marked by honesty, deep connection with the Father, and daily encounters that lead to genuine testimony and evangelism.

title: Today is the Day of Salvation
summary: This sermon calls believers to recognize that today is the most important day—because today is the day of salvation. Rev. Choi explains how we are all called, but only a few are chosen, and fewer still remain faithful. With Scripture from Hebrews and Psalms, he exhorts the church to resist spiritual complacency and the hardening of hearts by clinging to Jesus daily, listening for His voice, and remembering the greatness of our salvation.

title: Never Have a Bad Day Again: Rejoice
summary: This sermon emphasizes the supreme joy of salvation over all ministry success or life achievements. Rev. Choi urges believers to rejoice first and foremost that their names are written in the Lamb’s Book of Life, a truth so profound that it causes Jesus Himself to rejoice. Approaching faith with childlike humility opens the door to divine revelation and a joy-filled life that is immune to bad days, no matter the circumstances.

title: Thirsting for the Holy Spirit
summary: This Pentecost sermon emphasizes the ongoing need for believers to thirst for and be baptized in the Holy Spirit. Rev. Choi teaches that the initial deposit of the Spirit at conversion is not the fullness God desires for His people. Instead, believers are called to continually seek the Spirit’s power, gifts, help, and revelation. A renewed mind and a heart of love are essential for receiving more of the Spirit, whose presence brings unity, holiness, bold witness, and transformation.

title: Amend Your Ways
summary: In this sermon, Rev. Choi calls believers to go deeper in repentance—not just changing sinful deeds, but fundamentally amending their ways, motives, and mindset. Using Jeremiah 7 and Galatians 5, he challenges the church to evaluate their fruit and pursue a renewed mind and Spirit-filled life, warning against surface-level religion that lacks transformation.

title: When God Speaks
summary: In this sermon, Rev. Choi examines the story of Abraham and Isaac as a literal foreshadowing of the gospel. He emphasizes immediate and joyful obedience when God speaks, showing how Abraham and Isaac demonstrated radical trust in God's promises—even unto death. The message challenges believers to grow in absolute faith, rooted in the assurance of God's resurrection power.

title: Ministry of Mercy
summary: This sermon urges believers to embody Christ's mercy by caring for the 'least of these'—those often overlooked or dismissed by the world. Rev. Choi calls for a literal and personal response to Jesus' words in Matthew 25, highlighting that ministering to the hungry, sick, imprisoned, and poor is equivalent to serving Christ Himself. Mercy begins in the home and church, then extends outward to a hurting world.

title: Walk in the Likeness of the Resurrection
summary: This sermon emphasizes that reconciliation with God through Christ's death is only the beginning of the Christian journey. True salvation involves daily dying to self, taking up one's cross, and walking in the newness of life modeled after Jesus' resurrection.

title: Happy Resurrection Day
summary: This Resurrection Sunday sermon explores six different responses to the risen Christ, from doubt to absolute faith. Regardless of where we are on that spectrum, Jesus promises to meet each person personally, in a way perfectly suited to them.

title: The Merits of Extended Prayer
summary: This sermon highlights Jesus' example in the Garden of Gethsemane to emphasize the value of extended, consistent prayer. Through prayer, believers connect with God, overcome temptation, and receive clarity about God's will for their lives.

title: The Secret Place
summary: This sermon urges believers to consistently seek God in the secret place, where transformation, discernment, and spiritual strength are cultivated. Drawing from Daniel and his friends’ unwavering faith, Rev. Choi emphasizes that private devotion leads to public witness and endurance in times of trial.

title: Perfected in Jesus
summary: This sermon explores what it means to be perfected in love through Christ: to love one another deeply and to have confidence before God despite inner condemnation. Rev. Choi emphasizes that such love is demonstrated not only in actions but in truth, offering grace and reassurance as God does with us.

title: The Two-Edged Sword of the Spirit
summary: Rev. Choi teaches that the Word of God is a two-edged sword—one edge for precise healing through confession and repentance, and the other for spiritual warfare against Satan’s forces. Believers are called to wield this sword by speaking truth, confessing sins aloud, rebuking the enemy, and walking in victory through the authority of Jesus Christ.

title: God's Heart Towards Sinners
summary: Rev. Choi teaches from 1 John 3 that although God hates sin, He deeply loves sinners. A true Christian is marked by a life of growing righteousness and increasing love for others. Sin patterns must be broken over time, and loving well—starting within the church—is essential to genuine discipleship.

title: The Anointing of the Holy Spirit
summary: This sermon warns believers of the many antichrists and counterfeit versions of Jesus in the world, especially within the church. Rev. Choi urges believers to seek the true anointing of the Holy Spirit, whose ministry is to teach, protect from deception, and keep us abiding in the true Jesus until His return.

title: Live for Jesus
summary: This sermon calls believers to live for Jesus by first learning to live in Jesus—abiding in Him daily—so that we might eventually live like Him. Rev. Choi teaches that spiritual maturity involves growing from infancy to overcoming the evil one and walking as Jesus did, with increasing freedom from sin and deeper relationship with Christ.

title: Two Natures: Ishmael vs. Isaac
summary: This sermon contrasts the old, fleshly self (represented by Ishmael) with the new, spiritual self (represented by Isaac), emphasizing that only through Christ and the Spirit can we inherit God's kingdom and bear spiritual fruit. It urges believers to live by their renewed spiritual identity rather than their fallen, fleshly nature.
